attributes.action: Change the law, requiring all mobile enforcement cameras to have high visibility warning signs in advance of a mobile camera's position
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is without debate that speed is one of the major factors in all fatal accidents in Great Britain.
The recent adverts of a child being hit at 30mph having an 80% greater chance of survival, are really compelling.
It must also be acknowledged, that the change in policy toward the high visibility of fixed enforcement cameras has made a major impact to road safety.
Road users are now able to observe fixed cameras in advance and adjust their speed if required. This removes the prospect of a conviction whilst also providing greater safety with enforced speed reductions.
It is the lack of visibility of mobile enforcement cameras, that make their purpose completely ineffective as a speed reduction measure.
Their use does nothing to address the speed of the motorist, as most have no idea that they have broken the law until they receive a fixed penalty notice.
I ask of this “New Government”, to address this issue as a matter of urgency.
Make it a requirement of all cameras both fixed and mobile to have pre-warning signs with high visibility markings for the cameras themselves.
Prove to the general public that all enforcement cameras are truly sited for safety.
